title: The Zero Product Property
text: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
speech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
pacedSpeech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.

title: Factoring the Equation
text: We can factor $$x^2-625$$ to use the zero product property. $$x^2-625=\left(x+25\right) \left(x-25\right)$$
speech: We can factor  x squared minus 625  to use the zero product property.  x squared, minus 625 is equal to parentheses x plus 25,  times, parentheses x minus 25,
pacedSpeech: We can factor   x squared minus 625
to use the zero product property.   x squared, minus 625 is equal to  x plus 25,  times,  x minus 25,

title: Using the Zero Product Property
text: As per the zero product property, if $$\left(x+25\right) \left(x-25\right)=0$$, then either $$x+25$$ or $$x-25$$ is equal to $$0$$. Setting both of these to $$0$$, $$x=-25$$ and $$x=25$$. Summing these values, we get $$0$$
speech: As per the zero product property, if  parentheses x plus 25,  times, parentheses x minus 25,  is equal to 0 , then either  x, plus 25  or  x, minus, 25  is equal to  0 . Setting both of these to  0 ,  x is equal to, negative 25  and  x, is equal to 25 . Summing these values, we get  0
pacedSpeech: As per the zero product property, if    x plus 25,  times,  x minus 25,  is equal to 0
